title: stratcols
text: Stratigraphic columns defined using as_stratcol: is_stratcol can used test object valid stratigraphic column: Bed thicknesses can extracted using bed_thickness: can extract (unique) facies names follows: functionality includes
code: thickness = runif(10) #bed thicknesses facies = rep(c(1,2), 5) # facies codes  s = as_stratcol(thickness = thickness,                 facies = facies) is_stratcol(s) #> [1] TRUE bed_thickness(s) #>  [1] 0.080750138 0.834333037 0.600760886 0.157208442 0.007399441 0.466393497 #>  [7] 0.497777389 0.289767245 0.732881987 0.772521511 facies_names(s) #>  [1] 1 2 1 2 1 2 1 2 1 2 unique_facies_names(s) #> [1] 1 2 no_beds(s) #> [1] 10 no_facies(s) #> [1] 2  get_base(s) # lowest bed boundary #> [1] 0 get_L_unit(s) # length unit of beds #> NULL  facies_repetitions(s) # do successive beds have identical facies? #> [1] FALSE merge_beds(s, mode = "identical facies") # merge successive beds with identical facies #> $bdry #>  [1] 0.00000000 0.08075014 0.91508317 1.51584406 1.67305250 1.68045194 #>  [7] 2.14684544 2.64462283 2.93439007 3.66727206 4.43979357 #>  #> $fa #>  [1] 1 2 1 2 1 2 1 2 1 2 #>  #> $L_unit #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "stratcol"

title: Structure and classes of the admtools package
text: S3 class stratcol represents simple stratigraphic column. Structurally, lists 3 fields: bdry : numeric vector, boundary beds units stratigraphic column fa : vector, facies names beds L_unit : NULL string, length unit bed thickness fields following constraints: fa must exactly one element less bdry. bdry must least 2 elements.
